documents.document: Show us your tears, Tommy!!
I still don't want the Pats to win, but seriously, I've got nothing but respect. Maybe a little awe. Some envy, too. Annoyance? Yeah, also.
On question of Brady's legacy, case closed. By coming back from this deficit to force first OT in Super Bowl history. He's it. The greatest.
Deadlocked teams, seconds on the clock, winning drive in the making... this is what Super Bowl dreams are made of.
When the Pats' kicker can't do his own job, Brady will do it for him. Twice.
There's the helmet catch, and then there's what Edelman just did. Gif of the season.
These 'lil twerps are just the cutest. https://t.co/326NzSl5EF
Pete Seeger for the #SuperBowl win!!
I want to see Brady's face smudged with makeup-stained tears as if mascara is running down his face. Don't relent, Atlanta!
The world's lesson in US civics continues. What's a constitution, anyway?
@ByngBasketball No one told us it was a math class.
Great defensive dramatics by Saints, but Kits pulls off the win in their last home game before city championships next week.
Kits leading Saints 75-64 with about three minutes to play. I'd be specific but too many lights are burned out in the scoreboard.
@bcboysbball 56-52! Fat thumbs!!
KG Dragons beat Byng Ghosts 57-52 in battle of the undefeated.
Whoops! Byng looking in control setting up a three-point look, errs uncharacteristically and throws the ball away.
Byng turns it over, Yoel blocks the lane, and KG holds possession with 22.2 to play. He then sinks one of two free throws.
KG Dragons lead Byng Ghosts 54-52 with 46 seconds to play.
Some parents, I swear... they give opposing teenage players such grief. They're kids. Change the uni, and you're their biggest fan.
Awww, aren't they cute!! Parents crying for a "flagrant" foul as their precious gets stopped charging the lane. Game tied at 50.
For those of you wondering, KG point guard Yoel's first name is pronounced you-EL. His last won't fit in my tweets.
On Monday, refs T'd up KG coach Darko Kulic for vociferous, hyper sideline antics. Tonight, they're letting him do his thing. @kg_dragons
KG Dragons start the fourth quarter leading the Byng Ghosts 44-41.
@CoachEbe One-point difference, one minute to play in the third.
Bromige sunk 10 of Byng's 13 second quarter points to lead all players.
Yoel says, take that! Ends second quarter with rafter-brushing trey at the buzzer to go up 29-26.
End-to-end Bromige matching up against end-to-end Yoel. Classic basketball downtown showdown at KG. You should be here.
Bromige nails a trey at the buzzer to give @byngathletics a 15-12 lead over @kg_dragons after one quarter.
Before 10-0 @kg_dragon meet 9-0 @byngathletics a reminder: "Never let loss get to your heart or win go to your head" https://t.co/TrVnF3nuZx
There it is!! https://t.co/AXCH5Nu3P0
Hope the pedestrian seen walking in the bike lane saw this as an educational moment. https://t.co/P7hWDRioas
A wonderful tradition made terrible today. What a raw deal this is. https://t.co/wPd5P9qmXo
These are MedicAlert bracelets. Today the #VPD announces a partnership to help locate missing people, including tho… https://t.co/a6Z3f0rFbS
Walking along in the sunshine, casually talking aloud to myself... in Portuguese, so I really would have sounded crazy to most.
After an aired-out three sails into nothing, enthusiastic father at junior basketball game says, "That's ok, did you see that great pass!?"
Paramedics responding to an unconscious man on Water St. Brunch eaters witnessing the scene inches away over their… https://t.co/XvhZQkouqW
Most shocking is that bodies of last two known Beothuk were dug up and put in a UK museum. What a disgrace. https://t.co/XQpKWBLsbC
The best thing about pizza for dinner is pizza for breakfast.
There is nothing in sport like the Williams sisters. They are heroes.
These acceptance speeches are too Academy for my liking, but these women deserve every platform they rise to.
Damn if Venus isn't stealing the spotlight!
Who else would you most want to hug after a terrific win (23!) than your first and life-long opponent? These sisters. Poetic.
Deserved praise for @htsumura after three decades of important work. Inspiration to many, me included! https://t.co/66VnIjIvlt
Totally blew off a woman I was interviewing because I didn't want her to see me cry as she described families relying on free food handouts.
Know US runners from Alabama, Arkansas, Indiana, Delaware, Montana, Nebraska, North Dakota, Wyoming? #bmovm is this close to 50-state sweep.
You're a star, Howie. Been at it as long as I've been alive. Can't wait to see what's next! https://t.co/BmYTDF7de2
Coordinated dribbling is just wrong. Basketball is not Zumba. https://t.co/EJM4rbKii8
Spent yesterday writing about performance-based diet and interviewing nutritionists. So why not come home today to KD? #macncheeseplease
These trespassing Brazilian tourists can climb... but not fall safely. https://t.co/oIQ7ALm8Xa
When snow and ice lock down your track, you take training indoors and get creative like they did @ubctrack. https://t.co/EQllxNkFPr
Since I'm sick of being sick, I'm taste-testing mouthfuls of garlic and mouthfuls of oregano oil. Verdict: Don't do it unless you have to.
Player: "What team do I put on this form?" Teammate: "Huh?" Player: "Curry team? I made curry." Teammate: "Dude. Men's rugby."
Overheard one of the jocks say, "This was actually way better than I expected." Good food for the win.
Some of today's recipes made and enjoyed by rugby players. The egg and veg breakfast "muffins" were favourites. https://t.co/xc9fLj6X0G
Almost none of these athletes cook with tofu, but they learned to make the cheap, plant-based protein super crispy so they'll cook it now.
There were a few zucchini slices lost to the floor, but generally the knife skills were good --- and got better.
After these rugby players cooked this food, nutritionist advice is to fill plate with a quarter protein, quarter da… https://t.co/03sxTY4LhW
Athletes in the kitchen. Today, it's @ubctbirds rugby learning about the food that best fuels them. https://t.co/9R2yeVyzCl
It's my voice! I'm a word model! (13-minute mark, but don't skip ahead in this fantastic podcast from Barry.) https://t.co/OhCI6O1rse
Two wheels pointed in the direction of equality. https://t.co/dqPYznSGSb
This came up @ParkBoard meeting just now; GM said he wasn't aware of project and what it means for parks and CCs. https://t.co/5IAmDt6SZv
Heightened emotions and anger, much of it directed at commissioners and then to the public face of the aquarium, Jo… https://t.co/zd5EicSioW
The park board has decided to get more information on cetaceans in captivity and has deferred decision on pebscite. #vanpoli
Loud shouting: "No plebiscite without a moratorium," and, "Moratorium now! Moratorum now!" #vanpoli
Eighth participant in park board meeting is most definitely vocal gallery. Applause, "shame," "moratorium," "sell-out." #vanpoli
John Nightingale, aquarium CEO, sits in back row as park board meeting erupts with calls for moratorium. #vanpoli https://t.co/cA1Ab9BZvm
Motion now considered to refer discussion to staff for report because referendum is "blunt tool". Put forward by @catherineevans. #vanpoli
Discussion of cetaceans in captivity at Vancouver aquarium now has full attention of commissioners and a keyed-up gallery. #vanpoli
On motion about cetaceans: 117 emails support and 3 oppose; 4,521 signatures support motion; 557 want end to captivity at aquarium #vanpoli
Loving the white on white tailored pantsuit that @ErinYVR is sporting tonight for the park board meeting. Where can I get one?
"We are finding we are trying not to rush when we are being told to slow down." @parkboard staff on working with First Nations. #vanpoli
"They are working on a timeline of seven generations, really, of dealing with the impacts of reconciliation. >>> #vanpoli
"...that is used to working a bit more swiftly… We are trying to do our best to respect what they are asking. >>> #vanpoli
>>> "Nations feel moving more slowly is the better way to go rather than moving more quickly. It can be somewhat difficult for staff... >>>
.@JohnCCoupar asked about timeline on advancing discussions and relationship-building with First Nations. This was staff's answer >>>
On docket tonight for park board discussion: should voters decide fate of whales and dolphins at Vancouver aquarium. https://t.co/0xWvq38Yc7
Lots of media hanging around @ParkBoard meeting tonight, but first up is a committee updated from staff. Surprise! Up later, cetaceans.
Leaders and staff from @KitsilanoCC @WestPointGreyCC and @DunbarCC also hosted workshop on aboriginal relationship-building, as recommended.
At least 268 park board staff, beginning with youth workers, attended workshop on building understanding with aboriginal patrons and people
Congratulations Lex! Another success story outta @vgba604. https://t.co/WzNGOcDBwQ
Thousands and thousands in the streets. #WomensMarch #seattle #seattlewomensmarch https://t.co/VRZqnvuH5U
Walking down Jackson St. in solidarity with the resistance of Rosa Parks. #WomensMarch #seattlewomensmarch https://t.co/CF9MlSLaRO
There will be hell to pay, indeed. No one is free if we're not all free. #WomensMarch #Seattle #seattlewomensmarch https://t.co/vv9eQS0gzd
May everyone in the US enjoy the privileges Trump has know. #WomensMarch #Seattle https://t.co/msti2aF1UM
Pay attention @POTUS. #WomensMarchSeattle https://t.co/IYPoI0tpsW
Pussy power on the way to Jackson Street. #WomensMarchSeattle https://t.co/VFrvb0wIYC
@KING5Seattle "I've gotta tell y'all, run to your doctors right now." Morning speaker at #WomensMarch #Seattle
Police officer told me this morning they initially anticipated 40,000. https://t.co/hTKpPJ5nxi
Trump bops along to the songs with all the grace and decorum of a pre-schooler.
Bless sweet Sweden for this distraction. Sports for the win. https://t.co/JO1igYsbhX
"Totally unstoppable, bro. Like, jeah. God's got our back, bro. We're bigliest, bud."
He's going for gravitas. He's falling terrible flat. Repeated words, weak images, bloated hyperbole. No doubt he wrote this himself.
Trump can fake his reality so I choose to believe this choir is wearing pussy hats.
Jesus can't save you now. #InaugurationDay
He should have said: Mr. President, Mr. Vice-President. Ms. President-elect, Mr. Vice President-elect.
Looks like they made the little one stand up. I mean, teenagers, right?
Another one. We feel you, Michelle. It's real. It's the worst. https://t.co/PwSTRH86I0
Did one of Trump's junior henchmen just shoo the littlest one? That kid looks so alone.
March organizers made sure portable bathrooms and breastfeeding stations are set up along the route. https://t.co/zhtHAq6hhK
Can hardly imagine a more painful public disgrace than watching, from feet away, the least qualified man take an oath you should be saying.
